text: <extra_id_0> rel <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> Is rapidly tyrosine - phosphorylated following <extra_id_0> granulocyte-colony stimulating factor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> treatment of human neutrophils .

Stimulation of neutrophils with <extra_id_0> granulocyte-colony stimulating factor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> G-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) results in an enhanced respiratory burst , prolonged survival , and increased tumor cell killing .
The effects of <extra_id_0> G-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> are mediated by binding to specific , high affinity receptors .
<extra_id_0> G-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> receptors lack intrinsic tyrosine kinase activity , but activation of the receptor results in the rapid induction of tyrosine kinase activity .

Antiphosphotyrosine immunoblots of whole cell lysates prepared from neutrophils show that the <extra_id_0> G-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> rapidly induces prominent tyrosine phosphorylation of a protein of a relative molecular mass of 80 kDa .

Using monospecific antibodies , the 80-kDa tyrosine - phosphorylated protein has been shown to be <extra_id_0> p80c-rel <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , a proto-oncogene belonging to a family of transcriptional regulators which include NF-kB .

The induction of tyrosine phosphorylation of <extra_id_0> p80c-rel <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was unique to <extra_id_0> G-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in that <extra_id_0> granulocyte-macrophage colony stimulating factor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> which also stimulates neutrophils and induces tyrosine phosphorylation does not result in tyrosine phosphorylation of <extra_id_0> p80c-rel <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

The consequences of <extra_id_0> p80c-rel <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> tyrosine phosphorylation are not yet known ; however , tyrosine - phosphorylated <extra_id_0> p80c-rel <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is capable of binding to DNA , and <extra_id_0> G-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> stimulation results in an increase in the amount of <extra_id_0> p80c-rel <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> which binds to DNA .

These results demonstrate that one of the first biochemical events which occurs in neutrophils following <extra_id_0> G-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> stimulation , activation of a tyrosine kinase , leads directly to the tyrosine phosphorylation of <extra_id_0> p80c-rel <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
Thus , the tyrosine kinase activated by <extra_id_0> G-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> appears to directly transduce a signal to a protein which functions as a transcriptional regulator .
